natural problem: Given that 10 is the arithmetic mean of the set $\{6, 13, 18, 4, x\}$, what is the value of $x$?
natural solution: There are 5 numbers in this set, so we have  \begin{align} \frac{6+13+18+4+x}{5}&=10 \\ 6+13+18+4+x&=50 \\ 6+4+13+18+x&=50 \\ 10+31+x &=50 \\ 41+x&=50 \\ x &= \boxed{9} \end{align}

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "(6 + 13 + 18 + 4 + x) / 5 = 10"
shows  "x = 9"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Given that 10 is the arithmetic mean of the set $\{6, 13, 18, 4, x\}$, what is the value of $x$? The final Answer is 9
 ### Proof
 There are 5 numbers in this set, so we have  \begin{align} \frac{6+13+18+4+x}{5}&=10 \\ 6+13+18+4+x&=50 \\ 6+4+13+18+x&=50 \\ 10+31+x &=50 \\ 41+x&=50 \\ x &= \boxed{9} \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "(6 + 13 + 18 + 4 + x) / 5 = 10"
shows  "x = 9"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: What number should be added to the numbers 6, 13, 18, and 4 such that their average equals 10? The answer is 9.
